posts.post_content: Has anyone actually tested this guy in the current standard instead of just saying sligh sligh sligh sligh? The [Jackal Pup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jackal Pup) drawback is actually huge and a lot of the time you will get more damage out of a [Foundry Street Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foundry Street Denizen), especially paired with the [Burning-Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning-Tree Emissary) that is an automatic 4-of in every aggressive red deck.

Posted By: MechaKraken (9/20/2013 12:44:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have done the math, he's ok. He will do some work in standard, but short of that his is pretty shit. In standard now there is enough 2/1 one drops to make him a iffy early drop and drawing him late game is basically a dead draw. He will one for one at minimum, and in that event you take more damage than not. Unblocked he deals n+2 damage and you lose n-2 life.   
  
What I'm saying is watch him. He isn't an absolute tank and the rush beast people make him out to be. Jackal Pup was good in its day, but not so much now. I`d normally take Rakdos Cackler any day over him in standard. You won`t be blocking with the satyr anyways and if you can make a deck worth a damn you wont use the satyr as a sink until turn 5+, at which point you should have won. Be sceptical, but don`t take it as a horrible card. It is a shit rare, but not a shit card.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Some random guy after a game day event kept singing this card anthems of glorious praise and was willing to sell his child's soul to satan if I'd trade mine to him. I said "Sure!" and made off like a bandit, and I was even building an R/B aggro deck.   
  
I know how the game works, and I don't care how good or bad this guy is... I dunno, I can't seem to work up any love for him for anything but his trade value. I ripped another one in my last pack, so I'll give him a shot... but until he's proven himself, he's on the chopping block!
posts.html:

I know how the game works, and I don't care how good or bad this guy is... I dunno, I can't seem to work up any love for him for anything but his trade value. I ripped another one in my last pack, so I'll give him a shot... but until he's proven himself, he's on the chopping block!

Posted By: mrchuckmorris (10/19/2013 8:55:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Honestly never thought suicide red would be a thing, but here we are. It REALLY isn't that great to me though. Yes, I admit I don't tournament or FNM so I don't have much experience, but this thing is just lack luster. Everything your opponent can do to it hurts you, and everything you do to it hurts you. Just to prove that point I smashed this thing with a [corrupt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=corrupt) around turn 9 with [sanguine bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sanguine bond) on the field. Needless to say, my opponent wasn't happy. Point is, this thing is useful to some degree early on, but the longer you wait the more of a liability it's going to become.
posts.html:

Point is, this thing is useful to some degree early on, but the longer you wait the more of a liability it's going to become.

posts.post_content:
I never played with [Jackal Pup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jackal Pup), so I might not be this best judge of this card, but it seems like a pretty bad rare, but still decent.   
  
[Bellows Lizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bellows Lizard) wasn't played very much in RtR limited, and this card is [Bellows Lizard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bellows Lizard) with +1/+0 and two drawbacks. At rare, the drawback in the ability seems somewhat unnecessary.

posts.post_content:
I would change his pumping to:  
![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol): Firedrinker Satyr gets +3/+0 until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. That feels a heck of a lot more rare.  
(I am not a fan of powercreep. This pumping just seems more fair. And it is different in a more exciting way.)  
(There is also still huge potential for this card to hurt you more than it helps you.)

Posted By: Phelplan (10/8/2013 9:58:47 AM)

posts.post_content:
This guy will make new players drink a lot of fire in the prerelease, then take him out of their decks for game two. I'm not saying he's bad, just dangerous in the wrong hands.  
  
It makes you nervous as hell when you have him in play. You can still use him in combat with first strike ([Coordinated Assault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coordinated Assault), [Spearpoint Oread](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spearpoint Oread)), but you sweat the whole time. If he ever gets through unblocked, he has, "![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol): you and defending opponent lose 1 life each" which is always nice in super aggressive red.
posts.html:
This guy will make new players drink a lot of fire in the prerelease, then take him out of their decks for game two. I'm not saying he's bad, just dangerous in the wrong hands.

It makes you nervous as hell when you have him in play. You can still use him in combat with first strike (Coordinated Assault, Spearpoint Oread), but you sweat the whole time. If he ever gets through unblocked, he has, ": you and defending opponent lose 1 life each" which is always nice in super aggressive red.

Posted By: JimmyNoobPlayer (10/7/2013 6:46:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's no [goblin guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=goblin guide) or [vexing devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vexing devil) that's for sure.   
  
Underwhelming as a red 1 drop. It doesn't do damage as soon as it hits the field, it makes the perfect burn removal target (oh hey, I kill your creature and burn you- yay 2 for 1!), and its firebreathing is too slow to be worth much.  
  
1R *AND* 1 life for +1/0 is pathetic. R and 1 life for firebreathing would have made it quick enough to be playable. 1R and 1 life to give +2/0 firebreathing would have been acceptable as well.   
  
As it is, it's an incredibly mediocre rare so it gets an incredibly mediocre score: 3/5
posts.html:
It's no goblin guide or vexing devil that's for sure.

Underwhelming as a red 1 drop. It doesn't do damage as soon as it hits the field, it makes the perfect burn removal target (oh hey, I kill your creature and burn you- yay 2 for 1!), and its firebreathing is too slow to be worth much.

1R AND 1 life for +1/0 is pathetic. R and 1 life for firebreathing would have made it quick enough to be playable. 1R and 1 life to give +2/0 firebreathing would have been acceptable as well.

As it is, it's an incredibly mediocre rare so it gets an incredibly mediocre score: 3/5
